column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Sr2Co3S2O3 was synthesized by solid state reaction using SrO, Co (Alfa Aesar 99.8%), Co3O4 (Alfa Aesar 99.7%) and S (Alfa Aesar 99.95%) as starting materials.
#Text=SrO was obtained by heating SrCO3 (Aldrich 99.9+%) at 1080 °C overnight at dymanic vacuum (<10−4 mbar).
#Text=The starting materials were mixed to homogeneity inside a dry argon filled glovebox (O2, H2O < 1 ppm).
#Text=The mixture was then pressed into pellets and inserted into an alumina crucible.
#Text=The crucible was inserted into an silica tube which was immediately evacuated to high vacuum (~10−4 mbar) and sealed.
#Text=The sample was annealed at 1050 °C for 20 h.
#Text=The reaction process was repeated 3 times with intermediate grinding but the annealing time was set to 10 h.
#Text=Small plate-like single crystals were able to obtain by the similar procedures but were annealed at 1300 °C for 12 h following with cooling to 1050 °C in 96 h.
#Text=The samples are black and stable in air.
